japanese: 明日は雨が降るそうだ。
english: It looks like it'll rain tomorrow.

japanese: ジムはコンサートの前でリサを女たらしにしている。
english: Jim is womanizing Lisa in front of the concert.

japanese: 田中稔子さんは、広島の原爆の生存者であり、平和と核軍縮の提唱者として活動しています。
english: Toshiko Tanaka is a survivor of the Hiroshima bombing turned advocate for peace and nuclear disarmament.

japanese: 田中稔子氏は広島原爆の生存者であり、平和と核軍縮の擁護者として活動しています。
english: Toshiko Tanaka is a survivor of the Hiroshima bombing turned advocate for peace and nuclear disarmament.

japanese: 60年以上にわたり、田中氏は世界初の原子爆弾の現実を耐えた身体的および心理的なトラウマと格闘しながら、自らの経験を秘めていました。しかし、将来の世代が大量兵器がもたらす計り知れない危険を理解することを願い、最終的には自身の物語を共有し始めました。受賞歴のあるアーティストとして、田中氏は自身の芸術を通じて広島で起こった悲劇を象徴し、平和のメッセージを広めています。
english: For over 60 years, Tanaka kept her experiences private as she struggled with the physical and psychological trauma of having endured the realization of the world's first atomic bomb. However, she eventually began sharing her story, motivated by a desire to ensure that future generations understand the larger-than-life danger that mass weaponry poses. As an award-winning artist, Tanaka uses her art to symbolize the tragedy that occurred in Hiroshima and promote a message of peace.

japanese: ほんとうにちんこ小さいって感じだよね。

english: Although the rain started falling heavily, we decided to continue our picnic.

english: "Do you wanna keep the light on?" "Yeah, I'm still reading this book but I wont be too long."

english: I'd like to start gardening once spring begins, but I'm still deciding what sort of flowers I should plant.

english: I wasn't that into it at first, but it's caught my interest over time.

japanese: あの人、何も言わずに突然帰っちゃったけど、何かあったのかな？
english: That person suddenly left without saying a word. Did something happen?

japanese: 君の努力は必ず報われる。
english: Your efforts will be rewarded.

japanese: これ、意外と面白い内容だから、もう少し詳しく調べてみようかな。
english: This is actually pretty interesting, so maybe I'll look into it a bit more.

japanese: 文字が小さすぎて、なんて書いてあるのか全く読めないので、もう少し大きくしてもらえませんか？
english: The letters are so small that I can't make out what it says. Could you make it a little bit bigger?

japanese: 今この状況で、その話を持ち出すのはちょっと違うんじゃないか？
english: Bringing that up in this situation doesn't really feel appropriate, does it?

japanese: 彼女は、優しい心の持ち主なので、きっと喜んでくれると思う。
english: She has a kind heart, so I think it'll make her happy.

japanese: 新しいアプリをインストールしてみたら、とても便利で、毎日使うようになりました。
english: I tried installing a new app, and it turned out to be very useful, so now I use it every day.

japanese: 明日の夜は、友達と映画を見に行く約束をしているので、今から楽しみだ。
english: I'm looking forward to tomorrow night, since I'm set to go watch a movie with some friends.

japanese: 僕は、将来、人の役に立つ仕事がしたいと思っている。
english: In the future, I'd like to have a job where I can be useful to others.

japanese: 君の意見には賛成できない部分もあるが、視点としては非常に参考になる。
english: There are parts of your opinion which I cannot agree with, but it's very helpful to have your viewpoint as a reference.

japanese: なんで人は争いを繰り返してしまうのだろうか。
english: I wonder why people keep fighting over and over again.

japanese: 昨日のミーティングでは、重要な決定がいくつか下されたので、早急に実行に移さないといけない。
english: Several important decisions were made in yesterday's meeting, so we have to put them into practice promptly.

japanese: なんでいつも私ばかり、こんな目に遭うのだろうか。
english: Why is it always me who gets the short end of the stick like this?

japanese: 色々と考えた結果、やはりこのプロジェクトを進めるべきだと判断しました。
english: After some consideration, I've decided that we should continue this project after all.

japanese: なんでこんなに頑張っているのに、結果が出ないのだろうか。
english: Why is it that I'm putting in this much effort, but there just aren't any results?

japanese: 大事なことだから、もう一度だけちゃんと説明してもらえると助かる。
english: This is important, so I'd be really grateful if you could explain everything properly to me one more time.

japanese: 申し訳ありませんが、その件についてはお答えしかねます。
english: I am terribly sorry, but I am afraid that I cannot answer your questions regarding that matter.

japanese: 君には自信を持って、自分の道を突き進んでほしい。
english: I wish you'd be more confident in yourself, and followed your own path.

japanese: 私の部屋は、好きな音楽を聴きながらリラックスできる、落ち着いた空間だ。
english: My room is a calm space where I can relax while listening to my favorite music.

japanese: この言語の文法はとても難しいです。
english: This language's grammar is very difficult.

japanese: ToDoリストを作った。
english: I made a list of things that I needed to do.

japanese: 給料日、早く来ないかな。
english: Payday can't come soon enough.

japanese: 僕、正しいし。まったく！
english: I'm right, for God's sake!

japanese: ある日、公園で美しい夕日を見た。
english: One day, I witnessed a beautiful sunset at the park.

japanese: 最低でも1時間はかかる。
english: It'll take at least an hour.

japanese: 急ぎの依頼だったが、彼の素早い対応のおかげで無事に間に合った。
english: Although it was a last-minute request, his quick response allowed us to successfully make it in time.

japanese: やっぱり、彼が言ったことは正しかった。
english: What he said was actually true.

japanese: 読書を通して、様々な考え方に触れる。
english: Through reading, I'm able to experience many different perspectives.

japanese: この箱は見た目よりも重みがあり、片手では持ち上げるのが難しかった。
english: This box is heavier than I thought, it was difficult to lift with one hand.

japanese: みんなで協力して、困難なプロジェクトを成功させることができた。
english: By working together, we were able to successfully complete a difficult project.

japanese: カフェで友人と語り合い、楽しい時間を過ごした。
english: I had a good time chatting with friends at the café.

japanese: 出張のお土産に、有名なスイーツを買って帰ろう。
english: I bought some famous sweets as a gift from my business trip.

japanese: 一人でゆっくりと過ごす時間も、大切にしている。
english: I value the time I spend relaxing alone.

japanese: 彼は上を見上げ、空に浮かぶ美しい星々を眺めていた。
english: He looked up, gazing at the beautiful stars strewn across the sky.

japanese: 友人との関係を長く続けるためには、お互いを尊重することが大切だ。
english: Mutual respect is important for maintaining a long-lasting friendship.

japanese: 少し難しいので理解するのに時間がかかりそうです。
english: It's a little difficult, so it will take some time before you understand it.

japanese: この薬には強い副作用があるため、医師の指示をよく守って服用しなければならない。
english: Due to its strong side effects, this medicine must be taken exactly as prescribed by your doctor.

japanese: アメリカが帰ってきた。
english: America is back!

japanese: 翻訳する。
english: Translate.

japanese: その青い糸はもっとありますか。
english: Do you have any more of that blue thread?

japanese: 天国で会うまで彼には二度と会えません。
english: I won't see him again until we meet in heaven.

japanese: スーパー等の量販店に押され、魚屋や八百屋といった昔ながらの店は減る一方だ。
english: Traditional stores, such as greengrocers and fishmongers, are becoming less and less popular due to the rise of supermarkets and other mass retailers.

japanese: 毎週新しい本を図書館から借ります。
english: Every week I pick up a new book from the library.

japanese: この香りいいね。
english: This smells nice, right?

japanese: 車はあまり走ってないね。
english: There aren't many cars on the road.

japanese: ファッション雑誌を買いましたよ。
english: I bought a fashion magazine.

japanese: おかまを掘られた。
english: I was rear-ended.

japanese: 「これ、誰が書いたの？」「美幸よ」「へえ、美幸って、こういう字書くんだ」
english: "Who wrote this?" "Miyuki did." "Huh, didn't know her handwriting was like this."

japanese: 獅子はただ大きい猫ですからね。
english: A lion is just a big housecat, after all.

japanese: 彼らに都市を見せたよ。
english: I showed them the city.

japanese: 街を案内した。
english: I showed them the city.

japanese: 砂糖は加えなかった。
english: I didn't add sugar.

japanese: 砂糖は加えなかったよ。
english: I didn't add sugar.

japanese: 砂糖は入れなかった。
english: I didn't add sugar.

japanese: 私は錬金術師です。
english: I'm an alchemist.

japanese: 父に会いに来ました。
english: I came to see my father.

japanese: 日系アメリカ人です。
english: I'm Japanese-American.

japanese: トムの鼻が寒さで赤くなっている。
english: Tom's nose gets red in the cold.

japanese: 寒さでトムの鼻は赤くなっている。
english: Tom's nose gets red in the cold.

japanese: 処方箋を読んでください。
english: Please read the prescription.

japanese: タニナは倒れました。
english: Tanina fell.

japanese: タニナは倒れた。
english: Tanina fell.

japanese: 恐れ入りますが，もう一度繰り返してください。
english: I am very sorry, but would you repeat it once more?

japanese: 天気予報はどうですか？
english: What is the weather forecast?

japanese: 七歳です。
english: He's seven years old.

japanese: 夜は暗くて寒いです。
english: The night is dark and cold.

japanese: いつもにこにこしてるから、彼女は幸せみたいです。
english: She seems happy because she is always smiling.

japanese: いい加減にしなさい。
english: Start behaving appropriately.

japanese: 下記にコメントを残してください。
english: Please leave a comment below.

japanese: 病院へ連れて行って下さい。
english: Take me to a hospital.

japanese: 一緒に勉強しましょう！
english: Let's study together!

japanese: 一緒に勉強しよう！
english: Let's study together!

japanese: 一緒に勉強しようよ！
english: Let's study together!

japanese: 教科書を開いてください。
english: Open your textbooks.

japanese: テキストを開いてください。
english: Open your textbooks.

japanese: この単語をもう一度読んでください。
english: Please read this word again.

japanese: 最近では、オンラインで勉強することが一般的になり、自分のペースで学習できるようになった。
english: Studying online has become common these days, allowing people to learn at their own pace.

japanese: 書き言葉と話し言葉の違いを意識する。
english: Be mindful of the differences between written and spoken language.

japanese: 室内干しの場合は、乾燥機や除湿器を利用すると効率的です。
english: Using a dryer or dehumidifier makes the process of drying clothes indoors more efficient.

japanese: この本は何度読んでも新しい発見がある。
english: No matter how many times I read this book I discover something new.

japanese: 古本屋で偶然出会った一冊が、今では一番のお気に入りだ。
english: A book I happened to come across at a secondhand bookstore has now become my favorite.

japanese: 勉強の計画を立てておくと、効率よく進められる。
english: If you make a study plan, you can make progress efficiently.

japanese: ロシアはテロ国家だ。
english: Russia is a terrorist state.

japanese: ロシアはテロ国家。
english: Russia is a terrorist state.

japanese: 甘やかされた子供は嫌いです。
english: I hate spoiled children.

japanese: 彼女がそのデマを流したよ。
english: She's the one who spread the false rumors.

japanese: 女性は一般的に男性より７年長生きする。
english: Women generally live seven years longer than men.

japanese: 多くの陰謀論者が、未検証な発言を利用してそれらを事実と主張する。
english: Many conspiracy theorists leverage unverifiable statements and claim them as facts.

japanese: 彼女はドイツに配置されている。
english: She is stationed in Germany.

japanese: バレルよ、そんな音をしたら!
english: You will get caught if you make that kind of noise!

japanese: ネタバレが含まれている可能性があります。
english: There's a chance that it contains spoilers.

japanese: 彼女の感は結構当たる。主に悪い予感のときだけ。
english: Her intuition is quite accurate. Especially when she predicts things are going bad.

japanese: 君にとても似合ってるような気がするよ。
english: I have a feeling it totally suits you.

japanese: 人が話してるときにあくびをするのは失礼ですよ。
english: It's not polite to yawn when someone is talking.

japanese: 日本で百寿者がたくさんいますね。
english: There are a lot of centenarians living in Japan.

japanese: 彼女は来年結婚しつもりなんです。
english: She plans to get married next year.

japanese: ハロウィーンのときに皆はいろいろな仮装をしています。
english: People disguise themselves with a variety of costumes on Halloween.

japanese: 最後の手段としてこの鍵を使ってください。
english: Use this key as a last resort.

japanese: 彼らは国旗を掲げている。
english: They are flying their national flag.

japanese: デマを流さないで。
english: Please don't spread any false rumors.

japanese: 花の水を替えなきゃ。
english: I have to change the water for the flowers.

japanese: 世界の旗が全部知っていますか？
english: Do you know all the flags of the world?

japanese: 機会を逃しました。
english: I missed the opportunity.

japanese: 彼が戻ったら厄介だ。
english: It'll be trouble if he comes back.

japanese: これを食べたらおならがいっぱい出るよ。
english: If you eat this you'll fart a lot.

japanese: 地理学の知識は下手です。
english: My knowledge of geography is poor.

japanese: こいつの髪の毛と同じしたらどう？
english: What if I had the same hair style as this guy?

japanese: 正直な感想を聞かせて。
english: Let me hear your honest opinion.

japanese: あまり気負うな。
english: Don't get worked up.

japanese: タオルを絞ってよ。
english: Squeeze the towel.

japanese: クリスマスで何かを望んでいますか？
english: What do you wish for Christmas?

japanese: 鍵をあなたのメールボックスに置いておきました。
english: I left the key in your mailbox.

japanese: 可愛すぎて溶けてしまう。
english: It's so cute I'm gonna melt.

japanese: 試験を受けます。
english: I'm taking an exam.

japanese: 完全にはまっています。
english: I'm totally into it.

japanese: この箇所が一番深いです。
english: This part is the deepest.

japanese: 危機を脱してよかった。
english: It's good that you've escaped danger.

japanese: やるしかない。
english: We have no choice but to do it.

japanese: 辞書は、言葉の意味を学ぶために使います。
english: We use a dictionary to learn the meaning of words.

japanese: 音が進化した。
english: The noise evolved.

japanese: 韓国語を話せます。
english: I can speak Korean.

japanese: アラビア語を話せます。
english: I can speak Arabic.

japanese: ロシア語を話せます。
english: I can speak Russian.

japanese: 図書室の隅にある、古い本に心を奪われた。
english: I was enthralled by an old book tucked away in the corner of the library.

japanese: 困難な状況でも、自分を信じる力を失わないようにしたい。
english: I never want to lose faith in myself, even when things get tough.

japanese: 外付けハードディスクに重要なファイルを保存して、データを守っている。
english: I protect my data by saving important files on an external hard drive.

japanese: 水分補給は夏の間の体調管理の基本だ。
english: Hydration is essential for staying healthy during the summer months.

japanese: 植物の名前を覚えるのが最近の趣味だ。
english: Memorizing the names of plants has been a recent hobby of mine.

japanese: キーボードのショートカットを覚えると、作業が格段に早くなる。
english: Work becomes dramatically faster if you memorize keyboard shortcuts.

japanese: 健康意識が高まってウォーキングを始めた。
english: I became more health-conscious and started to go on walks.

japanese: 妹が最近、パズルゲームに夢中になっている。
english: Lately, my younger sister has been obsessed with puzzle games.

japanese: 友達とボイスチャットをしながらゲームをした。
english: I played games while voice chatting with my friends.

japanese: 友達と学校の帰り道におしゃべりするのが楽しみだ。
english: I look forward to chatting with my friends on the way home from school.

japanese: 野菜を多くとるよう心がけている。
english: I make an effort to eat plenty of vegetables.

japanese: 駅前の再開発が進んで、新しいお店が増えてきた。
english: Redevelopment in front of the station has continued, and new shops have opened up.

japanese: 疲れたときは無理をせず休むことも必要だ。
english: It's important to take it easy and rest when you're tired.

japanese: ワイヤレスマウスの調子が悪くなって、すぐに新しいものを注文した。
english: My wireless mouse started malfunctioning, so I immediately ordered a new one.

japanese: 学校で使うノートや文房具を新しく買った。
english: I bought new notebooks and stationery to use at school.

japanese: 夏祭りや花火大会はその街の夏の風物詩だ。
english: Summer festivals and firework shows are a quintessential part of summer in that town.

japanese: 健康の秘訣は無理をしないことだと思う。
english: I think the key to good health is to not push yourself too hard.

japanese: 健康のために週に3回ジムに通っている。
english: I go to the gym 3 times a week for my health.

japanese: 明日は学校で英語のスピーチ発表がある。
english: I have an English speech presentation at school tomorrow.

japanese: 笑うことは心と体の健康に良いと言われている。
english: Laughing is said to be good for both one's mental and physical health.

japanese: このゲームには物語性があって、小説を読んでいる気分になる。
english: This game has a story-driven quality, making it feel like you are reading a novel.

japanese: 昔好きだったゲームのリメイク版が発売されて嬉しい。
english: I'm excited that a remake of a game I used to love got released.

japanese: 現金で支払います。
english: I'll pay in cash.

japanese: この本に振り仮名をつけてください。
english: Please add furigana to this book.

japanese: 振り仮名はどうやって付けますか？
english: How do I add furigana?

japanese: 漢字にフリガナを振ってください。
english: Please add furigana to the kanji.

english: How do you learn foreign languages?

japanese: どうやって外国語を学ぶの？
english: How do you learn foreign languages?

english: It's my turn today.

english: It's my turn today.

english: It's my turn today.

english: It's my turn today.

english: "Who's on duty today?" "I'm on duty."

english: Seoul is a city in South Korea.

english: I'm North Korean.

english: It was rainy today.

english: There is sugar in that box.

english: Which chair will you sit in?

japanese: まだスペイン語を勉強してるよ。
english: I'm still learning Spanish.

english: A dog is the most devoted friend.

japanese: 犬は人間の最も忠実な友達です。
english: Dogs are humanity's most loyal companions.

english: My childhood friend became a musician.

english: I speak a bit of Japanese.

english: Please introduce yourself.

english: I could only find two.

english: I will buy some wine or beer.

japanese: ワインかビール買うよ。
english: I will buy some wine or beer.

japanese: おっと。こりゃ失礼しました。
english: Whoops. Sorry about that.

japanese: 次の日は、一歩も歩けなかった。
english: The day after, I couldn't walk a single step.

japanese: 見て。屋根の上に猫がいるよ。
english: Look, there's a cat on top of the roof.

english: Putin killed Navalny.

japanese: プーチンはナワリヌイを殺害した。
english: Putin killed Navalny.

english: Ukraine is a sovereign country.

japanese: ウクライナは主権国家です。
english: Ukraine is a sovereign country.

japanese: 今日から「花子」と呼んでください。
english: Please call me Hanako from now on.

english: I'm in the mood for takoyaki today.

japanese: 写真を撮ったので、分かりやすく説明できると思います。
english: I think I can explain it clearly with these pictures I've taken.

english: Tsk!

english: A brilliant, seductive chef turns to espionage in Napoleon-era France.

english: Can you read hiragana?

english: This product was made in Thailand.

english: What language do they speak in Eritrea?

english: "Son, you seem to forget, don't you, that I've got something stronger than a gun..." "You mean...?" "That's right, Jiu-jitsu!"

japanese: うっせー！
english: Yada yada!

english: Kaohsiung is Taiwan's largest port city.

english: How do you use this app?

english: Do you watch Korean dramas?

english: Do you watch Korean dramas?

japanese: お前の人生なんだから、何をやってもいいけど、人に迷惑をかけることだけはするな。
english: It's your life, so you can do whatever, but just don't do anything that causes trouble for others.

japanese: チャンネルへようこそ。
english: Welcome to the channel.

japanese: 彼の発言一見正しいように聞こえるが、よく考えると矛盾していることに気づく。
english: His statement sounds correct at first, but upon thinking carefully, you realize it's contradictory.

japanese: そなんに無理しなくてもいいんじゃない？ちゃんと休まないと、体を壊しちゃうよ。
english: You don't have to push yourself so hard, you know? If you don't rest properly, you'll end up harming your health.

japanese: 明日、面接だよね？緊張してる？
english: You've got an interview tomorrow, right? Are you nervous?

japanese: 自分の仕事に誇りを持っています。
english: I take pride in my work.

japanese: 失敗しても、誇りを失わないでください。
english: Even if you fail, don't lose your pride.

japanese: 彼は30年間この国を平和に治めた。
english: He governed this country peacefully for 30 years.

japanese: 朕は国王全然ではない。
english: We're not a king at all.

japanese: 「犬連れてきてもいい？」「もちろんさ」
english: "Can I bring my dog?" "Of course you can."
